column12: Suture-based closure device for use with endoscope
column13: A suturing device for use in conjunction with a delivery system having a lumen extending therethrough includes a needle operable to carry a suture, a distal shuttle configured to releasably secure the needle, a sleeve disposed on the distal shuttle, wherein the distal shuttle is movable relative to the sleeve between a locked position in which the needle is locked to the distal shuttle and an unlocked position in which the needle is released from the distal shuttle. The shaft is operably coupled to the sleeve and the control line is operably coupled to the distal shuttle. The needle may include a needle cap.

column13: A guide sleeve (50) with longitudinally offset bone engaging portions (72, 74) is provided for engagement with anterior-posterior offset vertebral bodies. In one aspect of the invention the guide tube (50) has fixed bone engaging portions in a predetermined offset position. In another form of the invention, the guide sleeve (80) is composed of at least two movably connected portions (82, 84) adapted to permit adjustment of the offset between the bone engaging portions (91, 93). Further, a method is provided for using a guide sleeve (50, 80) with offset bone engaging portions.

column13: Una manga guía (50) para fijar una vértebra superior (V2) y una vértebra inferior (V1) con un desalineamiento anterior-posterior entre las mismas, manga guía compuesta por un tubo (50) con un eje longitudinal (65) y un extremo de fijación al hueso (58), donde dicho extremo de fijación al hueso tiene una primera parte de fijación al hueso (72) para fijar la vértebra superior (V2) y una segunda parte de fijación al hueso (74) para fijar la vértebra inferior (V1), caracterizada porque dicha segunda parte de fijación al hueso (74) está longitudinalmente desalineada (70) con respecto a dicha primera parte de fijación al hueso (72).

column12: DYNAMIC STABILIZATION SYSTEM FOR THE SPINE
column13: A system for dynamic stabilization of the spine includes a bone engaging fastener configured to be anchored in a vertebra and a deflectable element mounted on the fastener. The deflectable element or bumper is configured and arranged to contact a portion of an adjacent vertebra, such as the facet, during extension of the spine, while offering no resistance during flexion. In certain embodiments, a cable may be fastened to the bone engaging fastener and arranged to contact a portion of the adjacent vertebra, such as the spinous process, during flexion of the spine. In one surgical technique of the invention, a contralateral approach is used to introduce the bone engaging fastener through the deflectable element and into the vertebra.
column15: LANDRY MICHAEL E;;WALKENHORST JARED W;;WILSON THOMAS G;;PAFFORD JOHN A;;KITCHEL SCOTT H;;CARTER ANDREW;;COMEY CHRISTOPHER

column13: A tissue gripping device for use with an endoscope may include a sheath, a control line slidably disposed within the sheath, and a helical coil disposed on and attached to the control line. The helical coil may include a proximal region where adjacent windings are in contact and a distal region where adjacent windings are spaced apart. The helical coil may have a sharp distal tip.
